title: Prospera, the eccentric private libertarian enclave in Honduras
summary: Investors have taken advantage of Honduran law to build a private city with its own rules, a utopia for those advocating the abolition of the state – a project that has proved divisive.

title: Macron to convene party leaders next week to discuss new government
summary: Weeks after legislative elections which produced no clear majority in Parliament, France still does not have a new prime minister.

title: Surprise, discretion and support: Western allies react to Ukraine's incursion into Russia
summary: Ukraine's armed offensive in the Kursk border region seems to have caught the West unawares, but their support remains intact.

title: With 31.96°C on the Egyptian coast, the Mediterranean Sea reaches new record temperatures
summary: On Thursday, the daily median surface temperature of the Mediterranean Sea reached 28.9°C, beating the record of 28.71°C measured on July 24, 2023.

title: Mickey Mouse on drugs, Elon Musk as a mass shooter: Grok's AI-generated images let (almost) anything go
summary: The new version of Grok, considered 'the most fun AI in the world' by its owner, Elon Musk, has far fewer restrictions than its rivals.

title: Lampedusa, the island that sits between two worlds
summary: 'Beaches of Italy' (4/6). Closer to Tunisia than to Sicily, this Mediterranean limestone rock bathed in turquoise waters has become a symbol of undocumented migration, where two worlds cross unseen: that of tourists and that of migrants.

title: Belarus pardons 30 prisoners sentenced for protests
summary: Thirty people convicted for crimes related to protests were pardoned by Belarusian President Lukashenko. A rights group estimates Belarus has around 1,400 political prisoners.

title: Aerobatic plane crashes in southern France
summary: A small plane has crashed into the sea near Le Lavandou during an airshow with the pilot feared trapped inside.

title: EU presses Meta on plans after disinformation tracker axed
summary: The EU has asked Meta to provide information about its efforts to combat disinformation after a widely used tracker was taken down.

title: Harris and Biden appear together for first time since president dropped re-election bid
summary: The Democratic candidate in the November US election and the president together celebrated the hard-fought price cap victory on certain drugs in Congress.

title: The surprise success of Kamala Harris supporters' Zoom calls
summary: Since Joe Biden withdrew from the race, Democratic supporters have been meeting in videoconferences bringing together tens of thousands of people, collecting donations and pushing for action.

title: Russia extends detention of Moscow concert hall attack suspects
summary: The four men suspected of carrying out the deadliest attack on Russian soil for 20 years will be held until November 22, as the investigation continues.

title: How algorithmic video surveillance was used during the Paris Olympics
summary: On a trial basis, 485 cameras controlled by artificial intelligence software were in operation during the Olympic fortnight. There has been criticism of the lack of transparency in the operation.

title: Olympic athletes worldwide receive heroes' welcome home
summary: After winning medals for their countries at the Paris Games, Olympic athletes have returned home, many receiving a star's welcome.

title: In Thailand, the heiress of a political dynasty takes power
summary: Paetongtarn Shinawatra, whose father Thaksin and aunt Yingluck both served as prime minister before being ousted by the army, was elected to the position by a parliamentary vote.

title: Pakistan reports first case of deadly mpox virus
summary: The World Health Organization has declared an international public health emergency after cases were also identified in Europe this week.

title: After 29 years behind bars, bank robber allowed out to take driving test
summary: The ruling has outraged a prison workers' union because of Christophe Khider's record of attempting to escape and the fact that he still has 20 years to serve. But it is part of a sentence adjustment request and a slow process toward reintegration into society.

title: Women's Tour de France: Cédrine Kerbaol becomes first Frenchwoman to win a stage
summary: Cédrine Kerbaol won stage six and climbed into second place in the overall rankings, 16 seconds ahead of race leader Katarzyna Niewiadoma.

title: Mpox virus: fears of global spread of a new, more contagious and more lethal viral strain
summary: Two cases of mpox have been identified outside Africa since the WHO declared the disease a public health emergency of international concern.

title: Gaza reports first case of polio in 25 years
summary: Health officials say the disease was detected in a 10-month-old baby. It spreads through contaminated water and is mostly dangerous for children.

title: Germany's Free Democratic Party is now promoting a 'car policy'
summary: Losing ground, the Liberals are promoting the return of the car to the city center, even if it means increasing tensions within the ruling coalition.

title: The 'Akon City' mirage fades in Senegal
summary: Launched in 2020, the American singer Akon's futuristic city project has come to a standstill. At the end of June, he received a formal warning notice that could bury the undertaking for good.

title: Convicted US Senator Bob Menendez ends political career
summary: The 70-year-old Democrat had been running for the presidential election as an independent.

title: At Barcelona's Contemporary Culture Center, suburbia and the roots of an American myth
summary: A playful and demanding exhibition entitled 'Suburbia' explores the origins of this world-famous phenomenon and its effect on the imagination.

title: 'Jim's Story': The pain of a surrogate father erased from the family picture
summary: Brothers Arnaud and Jean-Marie Larrieu deliver their leanest and most moving film yet.
